meanings.definition: A small piece of paper with a design on it that is stuck onto a letter or package before it is posted
meanings.sent1: I put a stamp on the envelope to mail the letter.
meanings.sent2: The stamp on the package showed a beautiful flower.
meanings.sent3: The stamp on the letter made it look special.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a stamp that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The stamp with the puppy was so cute!

meanings.definition: To bring down (one's foot) heavily on the ground or on something on the ground
meanings.sent1: He had to stamp his foot to get the mud off.
meanings.sent2: The dancer would stamp her feet to the beat of the music.
meanings.sent3: The angry toddler would stamp his feet when he didn't get his way.
meanings.sent4: The storm would stamp its authority on the land with thunder and lightning.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's voice would stamp out any noise in the classroom.

meanings.definition: A device for stamping a design on something
meanings.sent1: The stamp made a perfect pattern on the paper.
meanings.sent2: She used the stamp to mark her books with her name.
meanings.sent3: The stamp was like a magical tool for creating art.
meanings.sent4: The stamp acted like a mini artist, leaving its mark everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The stamp pressed down with precision to create the image.

meanings.sent1: He would stamp his initials on the document.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman would stamp his logo on each piece he made.
meanings.sent3: She would stamp her approval on the project with a smile.
meanings.sent4: The memory of that day would stamp itself in his mind forever.
meanings.sent5: The sun would stamp its warmth on the earth each morning.
